con:soapui-project.name: EspR4FastData
con:soapui-project.con:description: This REST service is only related to testing: it allows to reset an EspR4FastData instance which is simply used as an event recipient for the main EspR4FastData application that is operated in the QuicStart testsuite.

con:request.name: Request 1
con:request.con:request:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <statement> <epl> INSERT INTO LocalizedParcel
SELECT 'LocalizedParcel0' as entityIdId, ParcelMonitoring.vehicleId as vehicleId, ParcelMonitoring.deliveryStep as deliveryStep, VehicleLocation.latitude as latitude, VehicleLocation.longitude as longitude, VehicleLocation.metadata_timestamp as metadata_timestamp
FROM VehicleLocation.win:time(1000), ParcelMonitoring.win:time(1000)
WHERE ParcelMonitoring.vehicleId = VehicleLocation.entityIdId AND ParcelMonitoring.metadata_timestamp = VehicleLocation.metadata_timestamp </epl> </statement>

con:request.name: Request 1
con:request.con:request: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <registerContextRequest> <contextRegistrationList> <contextRegistration> <entityIdList> <entityId type="VehicleLocation" isPattern="false"> <id>Plane</id> </entityId> <entityId type="VehicleLocation" isPattern="false"> <id>Van1</id> </entityId> <entityId type="VehicleLocation" isPattern="false"> <id>Van2</id> </entityId> </entityIdList> <contextRegistrationAttributeList> <contextRegistrationAttribute> <name>latitude</name> <type>double</type> <isDomain>false</isDomain> </contextRegistrationAttribute> <contextRegistrationAttribute> <name>longitude</name> <type>double</type> <isDomain>false</isDomain> </contextRegistrationAttribute> </contextRegistrationAttributeList> <registrationMetadata> <contextMetadata> <name>timestamp</name> <type>dateTime</type> <value/> </contextMetadata> </registrationMetadata> <providingApplication>http://localhost:8080/EspR4FastData</providingApplication> </contextRegistration> </contextRegistrationList> <duration>P5D</duration> <registrationId/> </registerContextRequest>

con:interface.name: MockEventSink-API
con:interface.con:description: This REST service is only related to testing: it is here only to configure a dummy EspR4FastData instance which is deployed to serve as an event recipient.

con:testSuite.name: Main Unit Test Plan
con:testSuite.con:description: This test suite is mirrored in the wiki at https://forge.fi-ware.org/plugins/mediawiki/wiki/fiware/index.php/Gateway_Data_Handling_-_EspR4FastData_-_Unit_Testing_Plan

con:testCase.name: Administration
con:testCase.con:description:
Predominantly tested feature: FIWARE.Feature.IoT.GatewayDataHandling.ComplexEventProcessing.Admin
Minimally tested features: FIWARE.Feature.IoT.GatewayDataHandling.CommonDataModel.NGSI

con:restRequest.name: DELETE - admin/espr4fastdata
con:restRequest.con:description: Reset the GE, delete everything

con:restRequest.name: POST - ngsi9/registerContextRequest (Plane, Van1, Van2, VehicleLocation)
con:restRequest.con:description: Register the "VehicleLocation" type along with "Van1", "Van2", "Plane" entities.
con:restRequest.con:request: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <registerContextRequest> <contextRegistrationList> <contextRegistration> <entityIdList> <entityId type="VehicleLocation" isPattern="false"> <id>Plane</id> </entityId> <entityId type="VehicleLocation" isPattern="false"> <id>Van1</id> </entityId> <entityId type="VehicleLocation" isPattern="false"> <id>Van2</id> </entityId> </entityIdList> <contextRegistrationAttributeList> <contextRegistrationAttribute> <name>latitude</name> <type>double</type> <isDomain>false</isDomain> </contextRegistrationAttribute> <contextRegistrationAttribute> <name>longitude</name> <type>double</type> <isDomain>false</isDomain> </contextRegistrationAttribute> </contextRegistrationAttributeList> <registrationMetadata> <contextMetadata> <name>timestamp</name> <type>dateTime</type> <value>2014-05-16T15:23:12.234+0200</value> </contextMetadata> </registrationMetadata> <providingApplication>http://localhost:8080/EspR4FastData</providingApplication> </contextRegistration> </contextRegistrationList> <duration>P5D</duration> </registerContextRequest>

con:restRequest.name: GET - admin/backupObjects/contextRegistrationLists
con:restRequest.con:description: Read the registered context

con:testCase.name: NGSI core
con:testCase.con:description:
Predominantly tested feature: FIWARE.Feature.IoT.GatewayDataHandling.CommonDataModel.NGSI
Minimally tested features: FIWARE.Feature.IoT.GatewayDataHandling.ComplexEventProcessing.Admin FIWARE.Feature.IoT.GatewayDataHandling.ComplexEventProcessing.EventTypes FIWARE.Feature.IoT.GatewayDataHandling.ComplexEventProcessing.Rules FIWARE.Feature.IoT.GatewayDataHandling.ComplexEventProcessing.RealtimeData FIWARE.Feature.IoT.GatewayDataHandling.ComplexEventProcessing.Filtering FIWARE.Feature.IoT.GatewayDataHandling.LocalStorage.BackupOutputCEP

con:restRequest.name: STEP 1 : DELETE - admin/espr4fastdata
con:restRequest.con:description: Reset the whole GE, delete everything

con:restRequest.name: STEP 2 : POST - ngsi9/registerContextRequest (tmp123, TemperatureSensor)
con:restRequest.con:description: Register a "TemperatureSensor" type context, along with a "tmp123" entity

con:restRequest.name: STEP 3 : POST - cep/statements/{FilterTemperatureStatement}
con:restRequest.con:description: Create a simple statement that filters temperature that are greater than or equal to 15.

con:testCase.name: Quickstart (see the Users and Programmers guide)
con:testCase.con:description:
The goal of this example is to highlight CEP technology by easily merging cross domain events.
This scenario is about a parcel that is being delivered by different sequenced means of transport. Thanks to CEP technology, it is possible to localize the parcel in real time, by writing a simple CEP rule. At any time, the parcel is carried by a mean of transport (a plane, a first van, then a second van). This scenario involves two entity types: "ParcelMonitoring" and "VehicleLocation".
A "Parcel0" ("Parcel0" being the parcel identifier) entity is always linked to a particular vehicle entity at any given moment. The "Parcel0" entity belongs to the "ParcelMonitoring" type, which features the two following properties: "deliveryStep" (which could be like "ordered", "delivery in progress", "delivered"...etc), and "vehicleId" which is the identifier of the vehicle in which the parcel is being transported.
The vehicle entities are meant to be localized in real-time and as such, they belong to the "VehicleLocation" type, which simply features the following two properties: "latitude" and "longitude".
A simple CEP statement allows the merging of events from a given parcel, and the events from transportation vehicles.
The resulting merged entity is "LocalizedParcel0", which features both the properties from the "ParcelMonitoring" and "VehicleLocation" type.

con:testCase.con:description:
The goal of this example is to highlight CEP technology by easily merging cross domain events.
This scenario is about a parcel that is being delivered by different sequenced means of transport. Thanks to CEP technology, it is possible to localize the parcel in real time, by writing a simple CEP rule. At any time, the parcel is carried by a mean of transport (a plane, a first van, then a second van). This scenario involves two entity types: "ParcelMonitoring" and "VehicleLocation".
A "Parcel0" ("Parcel0" being the parcel identifier) entity is always linked to a particular vehicle entity at any given moment. The "Parcel0" entity belongs to the "ParcelMonitoring" type, which features the two following properties: "deliveryStep" (which could be like "ordered", "delivery in progress", "delivered"...etc), and "vehicleId" which is the identifier of the vehicle in which the parcel is being transported.
The vehicle entities are meant to be localized in real-time and as such, they belong to the "VehicleLocation" type, which simply features the following two properties: "latitude" and "longitude".
A simple CEP statement allows the merging of events from a given parcel, and the events from transportation vehicles.
The resulting merged entity is "LocalizedParcel0", which features both the properties from the "ParcelMonitoring" and "VehicleLocation" type.

con:testSuite.name: Weather station example
con:testSuite.con:description:
This test suite simulates a weather station monitoring. It uses different sensors for measuring temperature, pressure, wind, humidity, illuminance and location.
The Quickstart test case makes a combination of events sent by these sensors to provide a global weather description.
The Method-exhaustive test case adds a XSLT transformation and a subscription. It adds two rules for computing average weather of the day and of the week too.

con:testCase.name: Simplified testcase (fewer method calls)
con:testCase.con:description: The Quickstart test case makes a combination of events sent by these sensors to provide a global weather description.

con:restRequest.name: STEP 10 : POST - cep/statements/{WeatherStationStatement}
con:restRequest.con:description: Create a statement that merges events originating from sensors.
con:restRequest.con:request:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <statement> <epl> INSERT INTO WeatherStation
SELECT 'weatherStation0' as entityIdId, TemperatureSensor.commonLocationId as commonLocationId, TemperatureSensor.temperature as temperature, PressureSensor.pressure as pressure, WindSensor.speed as windSpeed, WindSensor.direction as windDirection, HumiditySensor.humidityRate as humidityRate, IlluminanceSensor.illuminance as illuminance, CommonLocation.altitude as altitude, CommonLocation.latitude as latitude, CommonLocation.longitude as longitude, CommonLocation.metadata_timestamp as metadata_timestamp, TemperatureSensor.metadata_temperatureUnit as metadata_temperatureUnit, PressureSensor.metadata_pressureUnit as metadata_pressureUnit, WindSensor.metadata_speedUnit as metadata_windSpeedUnit, IlluminanceSensor.metadata_illuminanceUnit as metadata_illuminanceUnit
FROM CommonLocation.win:time(1000), TemperatureSensor.win:time(1000), PressureSensor.win:time(1000), WindSensor.win:time(1000), HumiditySensor.win:time(1000), IlluminanceSensor.win:time(1000)
WHERE CommonLocation.entityIdId = TemperatureSensor.commonLocationId AND CommonLocation.entityIdId = PressureSensor.commonLocationId AND CommonLocation.entityIdId = WindSensor.commonLocationId AND CommonLocation.entityIdId = HumiditySensor.commonLocationId AND CommonLocation.entityIdId = IlluminanceSensor.commonLocationId </epl> </statement>

con:restRequest.name: STEP 10 : POST - cep/statements/{WeatherStationStatement}
con:restRequest.con:description: Create a statement that merges events originating from sensors.
con:restRequest.con:request:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <statement> <epl> INSERT INTO WeatherStation
SELECT 'weatherStation0' as entityIdId, TemperatureSensor.commonLocationId as commonLocationId, TemperatureSensor.temperature as temperature, PressureSensor.pressure as pressure, WindSensor.speed as windSpeed, WindSensor.direction as windDirection, HumiditySensor.humidityRate as humidityRate, IlluminanceSensor.illuminance as illuminance, CommonLocation.altitude as altitude, CommonLocation.latitude as latitude, CommonLocation.longitude as longitude, CommonLocation.metadata_timestamp as metadata_timestamp, TemperatureSensor.metadata_temperatureUnit as metadata_temperatureUnit, PressureSensor.metadata_pressureUnit as metadata_pressureUnit, WindSensor.metadata_speedUnit as metadata_windSpeedUnit, IlluminanceSensor.metadata_illuminanceUnit as metadata_illuminanceUnit
FROM CommonLocation.win:time(1000), TemperatureSensor.win:time(1000), PressureSensor.win:time(1000), WindSensor.win:time(1000), HumiditySensor.win:time(1000), IlluminanceSensor.win:time(1000)
WHERE CommonLocation.entityIdId = TemperatureSensor.commonLocationId AND CommonLocation.entityIdId = PressureSensor.commonLocationId AND CommonLocation.entityIdId = WindSensor.commonLocationId AND CommonLocation.entityIdId = HumiditySensor.commonLocationId AND CommonLocation.entityIdId = IlluminanceSensor.commonLocationId </epl> </statement>

con:restRequest.name: STEP 11 : POST - cep/statements/{AverageWeatherOfTheDayStatement}
con:restRequest.con:description: Create a statement that merges events originating from sensors for a day.
con:restRequest.con:request:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <statement> <epl> INSERT INTO AverageWeatherOfTheDay
SELECT 'averageWeatherOfTheDay0' as entityIdId, avg(WeatherStation.temperature) as temperature, avg(WeatherStation.pressure) as pressure, avg(WeatherStation.windSpeed) as windSpeed, avg(WeatherStation.humidityRate) as humidityRate, avg(WeatherStation.illuminance) as illuminance
FROM WeatherStation.win:time(86400)
GROUP BY entityIdId </epl> </statement>

con:restRequest.name: STEP 12 : POST - cep/statements/{AverageWeatherOfTheWeekStatement}
con:restRequest.con:description: Create a statement that merges events originating from sensors for a week.
con:restRequest.con:request:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <statement> <epl> INSERT INTO AverageWeatherOfTheWeek
SELECT 'averageWeatherOfTheWeek0' as entityIdId, avg(AverageWeatherOfTheDay.temperature) as temperature, avg(AverageWeatherOfTheDay.pressure) as pressure, avg(AverageWeatherOfTheDay.windSpeed) as windSpeed, avg(AverageWeatherOfTheDay.humidityRate) as humidityRate, avg(AverageWeatherOfTheDay.illuminance) as illuminance
FROM AverageWeatherOfTheDay.win:time(604800)
GROUP BY entityIdId </epl> </statement>

con:testCase.name: Integration with ZPA
con:testCase.con:description:
This is a minimal testcase to help integration between Telecom Italia Protocol Adapter and Orange EspR4FastData. All described REST payloads allow to simulate what is expected from the Protocol Adapter.
This work has been achieved commonly between Telecom Italia and Orange.

This is a minimal testcase to help integration between Telecom Italia Protocol Adapter and Orange EspR4FastData. All described REST payloads allow to simulate what is expected from the Protocol Adapter.
This work has been achieved commonly between Telecom Italia and Orange.

con:restRequest.name: DELETE - admin/espr4fastdata
con:restRequest.con:description: Kill CEP instance in case it was running and reset all data.

con:testStep.name: Reset dummy event recipient simulator - DELETE - admin/espr4fastdata

con:restRequest.name: Reset dummy event recipient simulator - DELETE - admin/espr4fastdata
POST - ngsi9/registerContext (SmartPlug type + id 000D6F000277BCC0)
con:restRequest.con:description: Register the "ParcelMonitoring" type along with the "Parcel0" entity.

con:restRequest.name: POST - cep/statements/{FilterSmartPlugStatement}
con:restRequest.con:description: Create a statement that merges events originating from vehicles and parcel.
con:restRequest.con:request: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <statement> <epl> INSERT INTO FilteredSmartPlug SELECT 'Filtered-000D6F000277BCC0' as entityIdId, currentPower FROM SmartPlug.win:time(10) WHERE currentPower > 10 </epl> </statement>

con:restRequest.name: POST - cep/statements/{FilterSmartPlugStatement}/eventsinkurls/{IotBroker}
con:restRequest.con:description: Create an event sink URL (event recipient

con:restRequest.name: POST - ngsi10/updateContext (000D6F000277BCC0)
con:restRequest.con:description: Send a "Parcel0" event, thus updating the properties of this entity.

con:restRequest.name: POST - ngsi10/queryContext (000D6F000277BCC0)
con:restRequest.con:description: Read the properties of "LocalizedParcel0" entity, which is the result of "Parcel0"+"Van1" merging.

con:restRequest.name: POST - ngsi9/registerContext - CarSensor
con:restRequest.con:request: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <registerContextRequest> <contextRegistrationList> <contextRegistration> <entityIdList> <entityId type="CarSensor" isPattern="false"> <id>garageCarSensorEntrance</id> </entityId> <entityId type="CarSensor" isPattern="false"> <id>garageCarSensorExit</id> </entityId> </entityIdList> <contextRegistrationAttributeList> <contextRegistrationAttribute> <name>passing</name> <type>long</type> <isDomain>false</isDomain> </contextRegistrationAttribute> </contextRegistrationAttributeList> <providingApplication>http://localhost:8080/EspR4FastData</providingApplication> </contextRegistration> </contextRegistrationList> <duration>P5D</duration> </registerContextRequest>

con:restRequest.name: POST - ngsi9/registerContext - Turnstile
con:restRequest.con:request: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <registerContextRequest> <contextRegistrationList> <contextRegistration> <entityIdList> <entityId type="Turnstile" isPattern="false"> <id>garageTurnstileEntrance</id> </entityId> <entityId type="Turnstile" isPattern="false"> <id>garageTurnstileExit</id> </entityId> <entityId type="Turnstile" isPattern="false"> <id>groundFloorTurnstileEntrance</id> </entityId> <entityId type="Turnstile" isPattern="false"> <id>groundFloorTurnstileExit</id> </entityId> </entityIdList> <contextRegistrationAttributeList> <contextRegistrationAttribute> <name>passing</name> <type>long</type> <isDomain>false</isDomain> </contextRegistrationAttribute> </contextRegistrationAttributeList> <providingApplication>http://localhost:8080/EspR4FastData</providingApplication> </contextRegistration> </contextRegistrationList> <duration>P5D</duration> </registerContextRequest>

con:restRequest.name: POST - cep/statements/{ElevatorSt}
con:restRequest.con:description: Create a statement that merges events originating from vehicles and parcel.
con:restRequest.con:request: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <statement xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"> <epl> INSERT INTO Elevator SELECT 'elevator1' as entityIdId, 'called' as elevatorState FROM Turnstile WHERE Turnstile.entityIdId = 'garageTurnstileEntrance' </epl> </statement>

con:restRequest.name: POST - cep/statements/{ElevatorSt}/eventsinkurls/{ElevatorSt}
con:restRequest.con:description: Create an event sink URL (mock event recipient simulator)

con:restRequest.name: POST - cep/statements/{CarCounterSt}
con:restRequest.con:description: Create a statement that merges events originating from vehicles and parcel.
con:restRequest.con:request: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <statement xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"> <epl> INSERT INTO CarCounter SELECT "carsInGarage" as entityIdId, sum(passing) as count FROM CarSensor WHERE entityIdId = "garageCarSensorEntrance" OR entityIdId = "garageCarSensorExit" </epl> </statement>

con:restRequest.name: POST - cep/statements/{PeopleCounterSt}
con:restRequest.con:description: Create a statement that merges events originating from vehicles and parcel.
con:restRequest.con:request: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <statement xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"> <epl> INSERT INTO PeopleCounter SELECT "peopleInBuilding" as entityIdId, sum(passing) as count FROM Turnstile WHERE entityIdId = "garageTurnstileEntrance" OR entityIdId = "garageTurnstileExit" OR entityIdId = "groundFloorTurnstileEntrance" OR entityIdId = "groundFloorTurnstileExit" </epl> </statement>

con:restRequest.name: POST - cep/statements/{PeopleCounterSt}/eventsinkurls/{PeopleCounterStEs}
con:restRequest.con:description: Create an event sink URL (mock event recipient simulator)

con:restRequest.name: POST - cep/statements/{AirConditionerSt}
con:restRequest.con:description: Create a statement that merges events originating from vehicles and parcel.
con:restRequest.con:request: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <statement xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"> <epl> INSERT INTO AirConditioner SELECT 20.0 as temperature, true as state FROM PeopleCounter WHERE count > 2 </epl> </statement>

con:restRequest.name: POST - cep/statements/{AirConditionerSt}/eventsinkurls/{AirConditionerStEs}
con:restRequest.con:description: Create an event sink URL (mock event recipient simulator)

con:restRequest.name: POST - ngsi10/updateContext (garageCarSensorEntrance) 1
con:restRequest.con:description: Send a "Parcel0" event, thus updating the properties of this entity.

con:restRequest.name: POST - ngsi10/subscribeContext (carsInGarage)
con:restRequest.con:description: Simulate a subscription to the "LocalizedParcel0" entity. The subscriber is the mock notify context recipient.

con:restRequest.con:description: Send a "Parcel0" event, thus updating the properties of this entity.

con:restRequest.name: POST - ngsi9/registerContext - Turnstile
con:restRequest.con:request:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <registerContextRequest> <contextRegistrationList> <contextRegistration> <entityIdList> <entityId type="Turnstile" isPattern="false"> <id>garageTurnstileEntrance</id> </entityId> <entityId type="Turnstile" isPattern="false"> <id>garageTurnstileExit</id> </entityId> <entityId type="Turnstile" isPattern="false"> <id>groundFloorTurnstileEntrance</id> </entityId> <entityId type="Turnstile" isPattern="false"> <id>groundFloorTurnstileExit</id> </entityId> </entityIdList> <contextRegistrationAttributeList> <contextRegistrationAttribute> <name>passing</name> <type>long</type> <isDomain>false</isDomain> </contextRegistrationAttribute> </contextRegistrationAttributeList> <providingApplication>http://localhost:8080/EspR4FastData</providingApplication> </contextRegistration> </contextRegistrationList> <duration>P4D</duration>
</registerContextRequest>
